main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg

Class TransactionLogMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg.LogMessage
      • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg.TransactionLogMessage

  • public class TransactionLogMessage
extends LogMessage
    Represents a transaction log message for the simulator. Is used by ERSSpecificModule to create log messages logging transactions according to BSI TR-03151. The parameters managed by this class are the following:
    • operation type: type of the operation this log, e.g. "StartTransaction"
    • client ID: the ID of the client invoking a start, update or finish of the transaction
    • process data: the original data that shall be logged, provided externally
    • process type: type of the process that is being logged
    • additional external data: optional data, provided externally
    • transaction number: the number of the transaction that is being logged
    • additional internal data: optional internal data
    The value of each of these parameters is determined by the technical guideline mentioned above.
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionLogMessage

        public TransactionLogMessage()
        Default constructor that sets everything that can be set without the need for additional data. That means, it only sets the version and the certifiedDataType and everything else has to be set through the setter methods. Using this constructor is not recommended, the others are far better.

      • TransactionLogMessage

        public TransactionLogMessage(java.lang.String clientID,
                             byte[] processData,
                             java.lang.String processType,
                             byte[] additionalExternalData,
                             long transactionNumber,
                             byte[] serialNumber)
        Constructs a TransactionLogMessage and sets all the data that can be set. Main constructor to later be used by the ERSSpecificModule and the TSEController to construct Transaction Log Messages. The operationType and the algorithm have to be set separately.
        Parameters:
        clientID - the ID of the client that initiated the logging of this process.
        processData - the data of the process that shall be logged with a TransactionLogMessage.
        processType - the type of the process that is being logged.
        additionalExternalData - reserved for future use, but could contain any additional data.

      • TransactionLogMessage

        public TransactionLogMessage(TLVObject[] input)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             TLVException,
                             ValueNullException,
                             ValueTooBigException
        Constructs a TransactionLogMessage from a TLVObject[]. Is to be used to retrieve information like the signatureCounter without having to go through a byte array. The calling method has to make sure that the TLVObjects in the array are in the correct order for a TransactionLogMessage and that the TLVobjects are meant to represent the content of a Transaction Log. Checks the length of the input array to determine if the array is too short or too long to be converted into a transaction log. These values might change over time if the TR-03151 or the TR-03151 changes.
        Please be aware of the fact, that the TLVObject[] has to represent the TransactionLogMessage in its "data only form". The first data present has to be the version, not the "wrapped-SEQUENCE" object that the SecurityModule produces.
        Parameters:
        input - a transaction log message in its representation as a TLVObject[] without the SEQUENCE-wrapper.
        Throws:
        ValueTooBigException - gets thrown by the conversion methods TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]) and TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[]).
        ValueNullException - gets thrown by the conversion methods TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]) and TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[]).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input array is empty
        TLVException - if the length of the TLVObject array is too long or to short to be converted into a TransactionLogMessage

      • toMinorTLVByteArray

        public byte[] toMinorTLVByteArray()
                           throws ValueNullException,
                                  ValueTooBigException
        Converts the TransactionLogMessage into its ASN.1 DER encoded form using TLVObject.toTLVByteArray(). It assumes that every value that should be present in a transaction log message is present, since it is only used by the simulator. Classes higher up the hierarchy have to make sure, that every value is present.
        The missing values signature counter, log time and signature value are provided by the CryptoCore which uses the result of this very function as input for the signature creation. The assembly of the whole log message in its TLV byte array form is performed by ERSSpecificModule.
        Returns:
        a byte array of the log message containing everything except the signature counter, the log time and the signature value.
        Throws:
        ValueNullException - if an (instance) parameter that should be present is not and therefore this Exception is thrown when trying to convert that particular value to a TLV byte array via TLVObject.toTLVByteArray().
        ValueTooBigException - if the value of an (instance) parameter is too long to have its length encoded according to the ASN1 DER rules, TLVObject.toTLVByteArray() throws this exception.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of a transaction log message object. It only returns the content of each parameter. If the log message should be represented in its TLV form, it is required that it is turned into a TLV byte array and that TLVObject.tlvObjectArrayToString(TLVObject[]) is used.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
